到達目標: Students will be able to evaluate two opposing sides of an argument and create a third option.
特記事項:
この授業を履修するには、事前にレベル認定の申請が必要です。詳細は備考欄を確認してください。

本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業の概要・背景: Students will look at different discussion topics with two opposite views on the topic. Students will be asked to evaluate these two sides and come up with a third option that was not originally presented. Students will discuss these topics in small groups. The topics are mostly Japan-centered so that any students who travel abroad will have had practice with these topics which they may face when living or studying abroad.

第2回: Discussion topic - Is Japan a modern country or an old-fashioned country?
第3回: Discussion topic - Is social media a force for good?
第4回: Discussion topic - Should Japan become a nuclear power?
第5回: Discussion topic - Should Japan stop whaling?
第6回: Discussion topic - Has COVID socially damaged younger people?
第7回: Discussion topic - Japanese society: does it need changes?
第8回: Discussion topic - Japan should reduce foreign aid.
第9回: Discussion topic - Kyoto is treated as a more important city than it really is in 21st century Japan.
第10回: Discussion topic - Students should take a gap year.
第11回: Discussion topic - Part-time jobs are bad for university students.
第12回: Discussion topic - Something is wrong with the education system.
第13回: Discussion topic - Society is in a persistent flux.
